content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.14 - Executive Order No. 14: [Appointing commissioners to examine laws with respect to sale and distribution of alcoholic beverages.]
State Regulations
TO ALL TO WHOM THESE PRESENTS SHALL COME, GREETING: The Alcoholic Beverage Control Law was enacted in 1934, following closely the national repeal of the prohibition against the sale and
distribution of alcoholic beverages. Although there have been periodic, piecemeal amendments to
the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law since its enactment, there has been no major
reappraisal and revision of the Law in the light of experience and current
social and economic conditions. To maintain public confidence in the operation of the

Alcoholic Beverage Control Law, I deem it to be in the public interest to make
provision for a thorough study and reappraisal of the Law, with respect to the
sale and distribution of alcoholic beverages in the State. NOW, THEREFORE, I Nelson A. Rockefeller, pursuant to

Section
six
of the

Executive Law, have appointed and by these presents do appoint Lawrence E. Walsh, Chairman; William C. Warren; and Manly Fleischmann, as Commissioners to
study and reappraise existing provisions of the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law; to examine and investigate the adequacy and effectiveness of existing laws, rules, regulations, practices and procedures with respect to the sale and
distribution of alcoholic beverages, including the licensing, supervision and
control thereof by State and local authorities and the methods and practices of
manufacturers, distributors and retailers of alcoholic beverages in the State; and to recommend any revisions necessary or desirable to strengthen and improve
such laws, rules, regulations, practices and procedures. The Commissioners are herby empowered to subpoena and
enforce the attendance of witnesses, to administer oaths and examine witnesses
under oath and to require the production of any books, records or papers deemed
relevant or material, and I hereby grant to the Commissioners all and singular
the powers and authorities which may be granted to a person appointed by me for
such purposes under authority of Section
six
of the

Executive Law. The powers hereby conferred may be exercised by the

Commissioners jointly as well as severally. Every State department, division, board, bureau and agency
shall provide to the Commissioners every assistance, facility and cooperation
which may be proper or desirable for the accomplishment of the purposes for
which the Commissioners are hereby appointed. The mayors or other chief executive officers of all
counties, cities, towns, and villages, district attorneys for each of the
counties in the State, the sheriffs in such counties, the commissioners of
police or persons having comparable titles or duties exercising supervision of
police forces within the State, the chairman and members of the State Liquor

Authority, and the chairman and members of all local Alcoholic Beverage Control

Boards organized or operating pursuant to the provisions of the Alcoholic

Beverage Control Law or any other laws relating to the sale and distribution of
alcoholic beverages are called upon to cooperate to make available every
reasonable facility and assistance to the Commissioners in the performance of
their duties. Signed: Nelson A. Rockefeller

Dated: February 15, 1963
